chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
hola! Bien gracias y tu?
muy bien, gracias! let's start! i'm at the starting point with a twig to my left leading to a small island
which way should i go?
Go to the left
perfecto! i'm now on the island with the tiger
which direction should i go now?
Go straight and then around the burd
Te entendí, así que primero tomé un desvío alrededor de la mariposa, luego me dirigí hacia la isla grande con un loro en un árbol, ¿verdad?
blue bird
entendido, he pasado el loro azul que está en el árbol
¿y ahora?
pasa por las piedrs
okay, i've walked past the 3 rocks and reached the island with the frog
now what?
Go around the crocodile go to the giraffe
Ok, pasé al cocodrilo y ahora estoy parado cerca de la jirafa.
pass la serpiente y ahi esta el tesoro
genial, pasé la serpiente y

¡mira eso! encontré el tesoro. ¡gracias por las instrucciones!

*finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
Hola! Bien y tu?
great! let's get started
first, move few steps to the left, pass under that wooden bench and cross the trail heading toward the florist stand
Estoy aqui
perfecto! now, pull a u-turn and cross the trail back towards our white dog friend again
I'm here. What now
awesome! now, you need to cross over that branch nearby and continue downwards
let's say hi to another white dog by a red and white picnic setup
I'm here. Now what do I do?
Genial, ahora camina sobre esa alfombra, trata de no pisar esas bayas y sigue dirigiéndote hacia el oeste.
I'm here
¡impresionante! ¡Ahora cruce ese puente de madera hacia el norte sobre el río!
ya lo hice
¡buen trabajo! ahora, asegúrate de evitar el arbusto verde, camina alrededor del lado derecho hasta llegar al puesto del florista

chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
Hi!
¡ey! Entonces, estoy empezando en esta tienda en la parte superior del mapa.
¿Cuál es mi próximo paso amigo?
ve derecho das vuelta around the dog
OK! I walked around the dog
Now I see a red mushroom to my right and a blue car further south. where do I go next?
Go around el fuego de acampar llega a blue car
alright, headed around the fire and reached the blue car! ¿now where to?
Go west and go around the telescope and see the house
perfecto, walked around the telescope and now i see the house
but, i also spot some rocks nearby. rock on or to the house?
Go around the right side of the telescope
okay, i went right side around the telescope
and. i can see the house, friend! i am arrived! *finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Hi! I'm ready
awesome! start by heading southwest under the first palm tree
got it?
I'm here
¡súper! Ahora gire a la derecha, pase la segunda palmera y luego gire bruscamente a la izquierda antes de la tercera en dirección sur.
Here
perfecto amigo! ahora gira un poco hacia la izquierda de ese lindo cachorro marrón, ligeramente hacia la izquierda y luego nuevamente hacia la derecha en dirección sur.
here
¡impresionante! Ahora querrás serpentear entre esa gran roca a tu izquierda (oeste) y la pequeña a tu derecha (este) hasta toparte con el océano.
here
¡genial! now you'll want to shift right (west) in the water, passing that large red crab on your right, keep close to that big rock as you move west
here
nailed it! now after passing a medium rock, you'll see a shark appearing to your coast side! don't panic, just take a sharp right
I passed the shark
¡Buen trabajo, compañero! Ahora regresa a la tierra entre la roca mediana y esa pelota deportiva tricolor.
solo continúa hacia el norte
I'm al norte. Now what?
excellent! now go a little to the left, northwest route, you will find a red tent on your left and a large speaker on your right
I'm here
perfect time for a little dance break with the music from the speaker, haha, just kidding! now, curve around that tent like you're tracing an arc, then head south but stop before hitting the water

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I feel better speaking in Spanish but I live in USA so I have to speak in Spanish sometimes
